security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown files that teach the MapReduce pattern. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file access operations are present. All references to CLI commands and framework tools are instructional examples only.

content.user_title: Execute tasks in parallel across AI providers
content.value_statement: Complex tasks benefit from multiple perspectives. This skill enables you to fan out work to different AI providers simultaneously, then intelligently consolidate the results into a single high-quality output.
actual_capabilities: Execute parallel tasks across Claude, Codex, Gemini, and other providers
Coordinate timeout-based collection of worker outputs
Consolidate multiple implementations or plans into unified results
Apply scoring rubrics to evaluate and select best outputs
Generate attribution reports showing which provider contributed what
limitations: Subagents cannot spawn other subagents; all orchestration happens in main thread
Requires CLI tools to be installed for non-Claude providers
User must manage provider-specific authentication and configuration
No built-in error recovery; timeouts and failures must be handled explicitly

use_cases.title: Multi-strategy planning
use_cases.description: Get conservative, aggressive, and security-focused plans simultaneously, then merge into optimal roadmap

use_cases.title: Implementation comparison
use_cases.description: Generate same feature with multiple models, evaluate quality, and select or merge the best implementation

use_cases.title: Bug diagnosis consensus
use_cases.description: Get multiple diagnoses of complex bugs from different models and synthesize the best fix

prompt_templates.title: Basic parallel planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Use MapReduce pattern to create an implementation plan for FEATURE. Launch 3 workers: conservative, aggressive, and security-focused. Consolidate into specs/ROADMAP.md

prompt_templates.title: Multi-model implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate UserService implementation with Claude, Codex, and Gemini. Evaluate each on correctness, performance, and security. Select best and document comparison in implementations/COMPARISON.md

prompt_templates.title: Consensus debugging
prompt_templates.prompt: Diagnose this bug with 3 workers. Each should: identify root cause, propose fix, estimate confidence. Consolidate into diagnoses/RESOLUTION.md with selected fix and rationale

prompt_templates.title: Domain expert synthesis
prompt_templates.prompt: Create implementation plan for API. Workers: backend, frontend, devops, security specialists. Consolidate into unified architecture document with attribution table

output_examples.input: Generate authentication feature implementation using MapReduce with Claude, Codex, and Gemini
output: • 3 implementations generated in parallel (impl-claude.ts, impl-codex.ts, impl-gemini.ts)
• Selected: Claude implementation with validation from Codex
• Test pass rates: Claude 96%, Codex 100%, Gemini 94%

best_practices: Define clear specifications that all workers will follow before launching parallel tasks
Use strategic biases (conservative, aggressive, security) to ensure diverse perspectives
Keep intermediate artifacts for auditing and future reference before cleanup
Set generous timeouts for complex tasks and handle missing outputs gracefully
anti_patterns: Launching too many workers (3-4 diverse perspectives is optimal)
Launching workers with similar or ambiguous biases (produces redundant outputs)
Deleting intermediate files before verifying consolidation is complete
Not applying scoring rubrics and proceeding on gut feeling alone

faq.question: Which AI providers are supported?
faq.answer: Claude via Task tool, OpenAI Codex via CLI, Google Gemini via CLI, and any provider with command-line interface.

faq.question: What happens if a worker times out?
faq.answer: The MapReduce proceeds with available outputs. Confidence scores are reduced for sections that would have benefited from the missing perspective.

faq.question: Can I use this with Claude Code subagents?
faq.answer: Yes, spawn multiple subagents with run_in_background=true, then use TaskOutput to collect results before reduce phase.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external providers?
faq.answer: Data flows through whatever providers you configure. Claude Code does not share your data with external providers automatically.

faq.question: Why not just use a single powerful model?
faq.answer: MapReduce provides diversity, cross-validation, and the ability to leverage each provider's strengths. Higher quality through consensus.

faq.question: How is this different from multi-agent orchestration?
faq.answer: MapReduce specifically handles parallel fan-out followed by consolidation. Other orchestration patterns may not include the reduce phase.
